intro: Alsine calycantha, commonly known as the showy alsine, is a flowering plant native to the eastern United States. It belongs to the family Amaranthaceae and is characterized by its delicate, branched stems and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, open habitats such as meadows and wetlands. Its flowers, which are usually pink or red, bloom in late summer and attract various pollinators. The leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance.
